comments.body:
Don't augment the existing tests (do fix if they're broken). 
Instead, add a new test that specifically covers this scenario.
There's already a test below that checks that the content is under the opaque bar. Here specifically call out that the inner content sees no top media query padding.
'Child sees no media query padding when below opaque nav bar'
Add comment here: e.g. the top is at 44px from the top because it's pushed down by the nav bar but the nav bar absorbed the 20px media query padding.
Is this done to imitate a status bar?  If so, it would be great if we could codify that as something more than what looks like incidental padding.  Maybe a status bar widget just for testing?
Added comment for now to avoid an indirection. Makes sense to make a function or something if there were any more status bar tests in the future.
